intro: Billardiera prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate devil’s ivy, is a low-growing, trailing plant native to Australia. It features small, waxy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Billardiera prostrata is often used in rockeries and as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
